description: An advanced, multi-platform AI content creation and publishing system using a microservices architecture. It leverages a crew of specialized AI agents to research, write, style, and validate content for various platforms.

architecture.modularity: Monorepo with Git submodules for core components (kolegium, publisher, etc.)
architecture.keyPattern: A linear, sequential execution flow is enforced to ensure reliability and predictability, replacing older, loop-prone agentic patterns.

keyServices.ai_writing_flow: The core AI agent orchestration engine.
keyServices.knowledge-base: Long-term memory and knowledge source for agents.

conventions.rulesEngine: All business logic (style, platform rules) is stored in ChromaDB, not hardcoded.
conventions.stateManagement: Maintains backward compatibility with legacy state models via adapters.
conventions.observability: Extensive use of Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, and structured logging.

lastAction: Completed Phase 1 and 2 of the documentation cleanup plan. Archived obsolete files and consolidated service-level READMEs. The documentation now accurately reflects the target architecture without modifying the 'target-version' directory.
